content: #pingamestrong pin display you will need cotton aran weight yarn i used rico creative cotton aran in pearl grey for mine you ll probably only use 80g or so 4mm hook 30cm length of 1cm diameter dowelling darning needle stitch markers optional row counter brew biscuits for dunking the pattern is written in u k terms and is worked in row stitch count in brackets at end of row gauge is not desperately important the idea is to produce a fairly dense fabric for displaying your pins i chose to loosely ch1 at the start of each row starting chain does not count but if you prefer to ch2 that s fine i reckon that unless you count your ch2 as a stitch it might make the edges of your finished piece look like they have a bumpy border special stitches half_double_crochet two together hdc2tog - yarn over yo hook insert hook into stitch st pull up a loop 3 loops on hook yo insert hook into next st pull up a loop 5 loops on hook yo and pull through all 5 loops on hook 1 ch42 turn 2 half_double_crochet in 3rd chain from hook and in each stitch to the end of the starting chain 40 3 loosely ch1 does not count as starting chain half_double_crochet in same stitch and in each st along turn 40 4 30 repeat row 3 40 31 hdc2tog twice half_double_crochet in each st until 4 sts remain hdc2tog twice turn 36 32 38 repeat row 31 your stitch count will decrease by 4 per row ending row 38 with 8 sts 39 hdc2tog four times 4 40 hdc2tog twice 2 41 hdc2tog and work a chain to keep the stitch tight fasten_off weave in ends press with an iron to ensure the bottom point sits flat and is sharp construction wrap the top straight edge around the dowelling and sew in place with some leftover yarn tie a doubled up length of yarn at each end of the piece of dowelling to give you something to hang it from i used an adhesive hook to hang mine up on the wall but a picture hook or nail would do just as nicely not a pin collector use it to display earrings or try your hand at embroidering a pattern or phrase on the finished flag mix it up with different coloured scrap yarns for a unique wall hanging maybe add some fringing the possibilities are endless please note this is a free pattern feel free to make as many as you like for your home and as gifts resale of this pattern and items produced from it is prohibited as well as being very uncool tag me in your finished items on instagram @ohforhookssake and use #ohforhookssake for bonus nice points © becky robinson oh for hook s sake 2017
